label: Description
value: Pattern shows five squares; three in wheel pattern and two in cross with details in needlepoint. Strip is set between two pieces of linen, one having a row of hemstitching.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technigue: grid of laid cords with needle lace, reticella style

label: Description
value: Strip made up of two bands of reticella (in identical pattern of squares containing alternately S-shapes and crosses). Attached edge of deep scallops of needle lace.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: grid of withdrawn element needle lace (reticella)

label: Description
value: Pattern shows angular band of reticella and triangular-shaped pieces of linen ornamented with embroidery and reticella. Two borders have needle lace, and one has a narrow band of bobbin lace.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: withdrawn element, needle and bobbin lace

value: Multicolored embroidery on brown gauze weave in a pattern of flowers on curving and angular stems.

label: Description
value: Fragment of woven silk with a design of off-set squares, each containing a rosette or star in brilliant blue, green, red and gold, on an ivory ground. Part of the Cope of San Valero, formerly in the Cathedral of Lérida, Spain.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic Technique: two interconnected plain weave structures (lampas) Label: silk and metallic lampas

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 18.1 x 16.8 cm (7 1/8 x 6 5/8 in.)

label: Description
value: At right side, an architectural detail of a portico with steps. On left side from top to bottom, an array of flowers are festooned, mostly roses with morning glories at top. A small pond at bottom from which grow water grasses. Printed in brown, green, and ivory on tan field.

label: Description

Component "a" has interlacing lines of bright and dark red with gold thread accents.

Fragment of a garment with embroidered inscription

label: Description
value:
Natural linen ground with Arabic inscription embroidered in red silk. Translation: "In the name of God, the Merciful, the Compassionate. Praise be to God, Lord of the Worlds. Glory from God to the Caliph, Ja'far Allah (sic) al-Muqtador Billah."  
Elements of one set of the linen plain weave were removed to prepare the foundation for rows of back stitch using red silk. The serifs and tails are satin stitch using red silk.

label: Object Type
value: Fragment of a garment with embroidered inscription

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery, linen foundation Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Fragment of woven silk with a teardrop-shaped motif, filled with small flowering vine, flanked by confronted eagles and addorsed gazelles. In blue and tan with silver metallic.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, linen wound with silvered goldbeater's skin Technique: plain weave with supplementary wefts
Stage Design: Interior of Palace Halls

label: Description
value: Two vertical rectangles on one sheet, both showing circular halls with balustrades running above the vaults of the ground floor. Richly decorated with coupled columns and cloth hangings.

value: Pen and bistre, brush and sepia wash on paper

label: Description
value: Project design. A gateway in a garden or villa wall. The pair of iron gates is flanked by pairs of pilasters and on each side a projecting freestanding coumn. Pilasters and columns have ionic capitals. Each cornice is topped by an urn sprouting scraggly leaves. Below is the groundplan, and measurement scale.
